org.apache.hadoop.fs.s3a

Class S3AUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.fs.s3a.S3AUtils

  • @InterfaceAudience.Private
 @InterfaceStability.Evolving
public final class S3AUtils
extends Object
    Utility methods for S3A code.

      An interface for use in lambda-expressions working with directory tree listings.

    • Method Detail

      • translateException

        public static IOException translateException(String operation,
                                             org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path,
                                             com.amazonaws.AmazonClientException exception)
        Translate an exception raised in an operation into an IOException. The specific type of IOException depends on the class of AmazonClientException passed in, and any status codes included in the operation. That is: HTTP error codes are examined and can be used to build a more specific response.
        Parameters:
        operation - operation
        path - path operated on (must not be null)
        exception - amazon exception raised
        Returns:
        an IOE which wraps the caught exception.
        See Also:
        S3 Error responses, Amazon S3 Error Best Practices, Dynamo DB Commmon errors

      • translateException

        public static IOException translateException(@Nullable
                                             String operation,
                                             String path,
                                             com.amazonaws.SdkBaseException exception)
        Translate an exception raised in an operation into an IOException. The specific type of IOException depends on the class of AmazonClientException passed in, and any status codes included in the operation. That is: HTTP error codes are examined and can be used to build a more specific response.
        Parameters:
        operation - operation
        path - path operated on (may be null)
        exception - amazon exception raised
        Returns:
        an IOE which wraps the caught exception.

                                           String path,
                                           ExecutionException ee)
        Extract an exception from a failed future, and convert to an IOE.
        Parameters:
        operation - operation which failed
        path - path operated on (may be null)
        ee - execution exception
        Returns:
        an IOE which can be thrown

      • isThrottleException

        public static boolean isThrottleException(Exception ex)
        Is the exception an instance of a throttling exception. That is an AmazonServiceException with a 503 response, any exception from DynamoDB for limits exceeded, or an AWSServiceThrottledException.
        Parameters:
        ex - exception to examine
        Returns:
        true if it is considered a throttling exception

      • signifiesConnectionBroken

        public static boolean signifiesConnectionBroken(com.amazonaws.SdkBaseException ex)
        Cue that an AWS exception is likely to be an EOF Exception based on the message coming back from an XML/JSON parser. This is likely to be brittle, so only a hint.
        Parameters:
        ex - exception
        Returns:
        true if this is believed to be a sign the connection was broken.

      • translateDynamoDBException

        public static IOException translateDynamoDBException(String message,
                                                     com.amazonaws.services.dynamodbv2.model.AmazonDynamoDBException ex)
        Translate a DynamoDB exception into an IOException.
        Parameters:
        message - preformatted message for the exception
        ex - exception
        Returns:
        an exception to throw.

      • translateMultiObjectDeleteException

        public static IOException translateMultiObjectDeleteException(String message,
                                                              com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.MultiObjectDeleteException ex)
        A MultiObjectDeleteException is raised if one or more delete objects listed in a bulk DELETE operation failed. The top-level exception is therefore just "something wasn't deleted", but doesn't include the what or the why. This translation will extract an AccessDeniedException if that's one of the causes, otherwise grabs the status code and uses it in the returned exception.
        Parameters:
        message - text for the exception
        ex - exception to translate
        Returns:
        an IOE with more detail.

        public static String stringify(com.amazonaws.AmazonServiceException e)

        Parameters:
        e - exception
        Returns:
        string details

      • createFileStatus

        public static S3AFileStatus createFileStatus(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path keyPath,
                                             com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.S3ObjectSummary summary,
                                             long blockSize,
                                             String owner)
        Create a files status instance from a listing.
        Parameters:
        keyPath - path to entry
        summary - summary from AWS
        blockSize - block size to declare.
        owner - owner of the file
        Returns:
        a status entry

      • createUploadFileStatus

        public static S3AFileStatus createUploadFileStatus(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path keyPath,
                                                   boolean isDir,
                                                   long size,
                                                   long blockSize,
                                                   String owner)
        Create a file status for object we just uploaded. For files, we use current time as modification time, since s3a uses S3's service-based modification time, which will not be available until we do a getFileStatus() later on.
        Parameters:
        keyPath - path for created object
        isDir - true iff directory
        size - file length
        blockSize - block size for file status
        owner - Hadoop username
        Returns:
        a status entry

        Parameters:

        size - object size
        Returns:

      • createAWSCredentialProvider

        public static com.amazonaws.auth.AWSCredentialsProvider createAWSCredentialProvider(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                                                                    Class<?> credClass,
                                                                                    URI uri)
                                                                             throws IOException
        Create an AWS credential provider from its class by using reflection. The class must implement one of the following means of construction, which are attempted in order:
        1. a public constructor accepting java.net.URI and org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration
        2. a public static method named getInstance that accepts no arguments and returns an instance of com.amazonaws.auth.AWSCredentialsProvider, or
        3. a public default constructor.
        Parameters:
        conf - configuration
        credClass - credential class
        uri - URI of the FS
        Returns:
        the instantiated class
        Throws:
        IOException - on any instantiation failure.

      • getAWSAccessKeys

        public static S3xLoginHelper.Login getAWSAccessKeys(URI name,
                                                    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf)
                                             throws IOException
        Return the access key and secret for S3 API use. Credentials may exist in configuration, within credential providers or indicated in the UserInfo of the name URI param.
        Parameters:
        name - the URI for which we need the access keys; may be null
        conf - the Configuration object to interrogate for keys.
        Returns:
        AWSAccessKeys
        Throws:
        IOException - problems retrieving passwords from KMS.

      • lookupPassword

        public static String lookupPassword(String bucket,
                                    org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                    String baseKey,
                                    String overrideVal)
                             throws IOException
        Get a password from a configuration, including JCEKS files, handling both the absolute key and bucket override.
        Parameters:
        bucket - bucket or "" if none known
        conf - configuration
        baseKey - base key to look up, e.g "fs.s3a.secret.key"
        overrideVal - override value: if non empty this is used instead of querying the configuration.
        Returns:
        a password or "".
        Throws:
        IOException - on any IO problem
        IllegalArgumentException - bad arguments

      • getMultipartSizeProperty

        public static long getMultipartSizeProperty(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                            String property,
                                            long defVal)
        Get a size property from the configuration: this property must be at least equal to Constants.MULTIPART_MIN_SIZE. If it is too small, it is rounded up to that minimum, and a warning printed.
        Parameters:
        conf - configuration
        property - property name
        defVal - default value
        Returns:
        the value, guaranteed to be above the minimum size

      • ensureOutputParameterInRange

        public static int ensureOutputParameterInRange(String name,
                                               long size)
        Ensure that the long value is in the range of an integer.
        Parameters:
        name - property name for error messages
        size - original size
        Returns:
        the size, guaranteed to be less than or equal to the max value of an integer.

      • propagateBucketOptions

        public static org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration propagateBucketOptions(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration source,
                                                                          String bucket)
        Propagates bucket-specific settings into generic S3A configuration keys. This is done by propagating the values of the form fs.s3a.bucket.${bucket}.key to fs.s3a.key, for all values of "key" other than a small set of unmodifiable values. The source of the updated property is set to the key name of the bucket property, to aid in diagnostics of where things came from. Returns a new configuration. Why the clone? You can use the same conf for different filesystems, and the original values are not updated. The fs.s3a.impl property cannot be set, nor can any with the prefix fs.s3a.bucket. This method does not propagate security provider path information from the S3A property into the Hadoop common provider: callers must call patchSecurityCredentialProviders(Configuration) explicitly.
        Parameters:
        source - Source Configuration object.
        bucket - bucket name. Must not be empty.
        Returns:
        a (potentially) patched clone of the original.

      • deleteQuietly

        public static void deleteQuietly(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem fs,
                                 org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path,
                                 boolean recursive)
        Delete a path quietly: failures are logged at DEBUG.

      • listAndFilter

        public static List<org.apache.hadoop.fs.LocatedFileStatus> listAndFilter(org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem fileSystem,
                                                                         org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path,
                                                                         boolean recursive,
                                                                         org.apache.hadoop.fs.PathFilter filter)
                                                                  throws IOException
        List located files and filter them as a classic listFiles(path, filter) would do.
        Parameters:
        fileSystem - filesystem
        path - path to list
        recursive - recursive listing?
        filter - filter for the filename
        Returns:
        the filtered list of entries
        Throws:
        IOException - IO failure.

      • maybe

        public static <T> Optional<T> maybe(boolean include,
                                    T value)
        Convert a value into a non-empty Optional instance if the value of include is true.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of option.
        Parameters:
        include - flag to indicate the value is to be included.
        value - value to return
        Returns:
        if include is false, Optional.empty. Otherwise, the value.

      • closeAll

        public static void closeAll(org.slf4j.Logger log,
                            Closeable... closeables)
        Close the Closeable objects and ignore any Exception or null pointers. (This is the SLF4J equivalent of that in IOUtils).
        Parameters:
        log - the log to log at debug level. Can be null.
        closeables - the objects to close

      • setBucketOption

        public static void setBucketOption(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                   String bucket,
                                   String genericKey,
                                   String value)
        Set a bucket-specific property to a particular value. If the generic key passed in has an fs.s3a. prefix, that's stripped off, so that when the the bucket properties are propagated down to the generic values, that value gets copied down.
        Parameters:
        conf - configuration to set
        bucket - bucket name
        genericKey - key; can start with "fs.s3a."
        value - value to set

      • clearBucketOption

        public static void clearBucketOption(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                     String bucket,
                                     String genericKey)
        Clear a bucket-specific property. If the generic key passed in has an fs.s3a. prefix, that's stripped off, so that when the the bucket properties are propagated down to the generic values, that value gets copied down.
        Parameters:
        conf - configuration to set
        bucket - bucket name
        genericKey - key; can start with "fs.s3a."

      • getBucketOption

        public static String getBucketOption(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration conf,
                                     String bucket,
                                     String genericKey)
        Get a bucket-specific property. If the generic key passed in has an fs.s3a. prefix, that's stripped off.
        Parameters:
        conf - configuration to set
        bucket - bucket name
        genericKey - key; can start with "fs.s3a."
        Returns:
        the bucket option, null if there is none
